Oh, how can God bear with the misdeeds of those who have had great light and advantages, and yet follow the course of their own choosing, to their eternal harm! Solomon, who at the dedication of the temple had solemnly charged the people, "Let your heart therefore be perfect with the Lord our God" (1 Kings 8:61), chose his own way, and in his heart separated from God. The mind that was once given to God and inspired of Him to write the most precious words of wisdom (the book of Proverbs),--truths which are immortalized,--that noble mind, through evil associations and yielding to temptation, became inefficient, weak in moral power, and Solomon 
                                                                           219
dishonored himself, dishonored Israel, and dishonored God.
